info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:08PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Lewis and Clark, southeastern Teton and central Cascade Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 808 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Augusta to 11 miles southeast of Cascade. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Cascade, Fairfield, Black Eagle, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Eden, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Sun River, Ulm, Sand Coulee, Simms and Malmstrom Afb. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 252 and 304. Highway 200 between mile markers 4 and 5, and between mile markers 118 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 44 and 63. Highway 89 between mile markers 65 and 70, between mile markers 9 and 40, and between mile markers 89 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
